com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common

Class Menu

  • com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.Menu

  • public class Menu

    A generic menu class for console based interactions with user. Inspired by https://github.com/bryandh/genericmenu, but adjusted to our the particular needs of this project.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Menu(Renderer renderer)
      A generic menu class for console based interactions with user. Inspired by https://github.com/bryandh/genericmenu, but adjusted to our the particular needs of this project.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Menu addItem(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String label, Function0<Unit> action, boolean isTerminating)
      Adds a menu item to the list of the menu items. The order in which the items are added matters. If the exit option is set (@see Menu.setExitOption then it will be displayed always as the last element in the menu.
      Menu setExitOption(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String label)
      Sets the exit option with given key and label.
      void showMenu()
      Shows the menu built out of the given menu items and (if present) exit option.
      Menu withExceptionHandler(Function1<? super java.lang.Exception,Unit> handler)
      Assigns the exception handler for this menu. The exception handler is invoked every time any of the menu item selection handler function throws an exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Menu

        public Menu(Renderer renderer)

        A generic menu class for console based interactions with user. Inspired by https://github.com/bryandh/genericmenu, but adjusted to our the particular needs of this project.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public Menu addItem(java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.String label,
                    Function0<Unit> action,
                    boolean isTerminating)

        Adds a menu item to the list of the menu items. The order in which the items are added matters. If the exit option is set (@see Menu.setExitOption then it will be displayed always as the last element in the menu.

        Parameters:
        key - itemization label. E.g. If you pass "1", it will be displayed as 1.
        label - menu item label
        action - lambda that is executed when user selects this option.
        isTerminating - flag that specifies whether the completion of the action should exit this menu.
        See Also:
        Menu.setExitOption

      • withExceptionHandler

        public Menu withExceptionHandler(Function1<? super java.lang.Exception,Unit> handler)

        Assigns the exception handler for this menu. The exception handler is invoked every time any of the menu item selection handler function throws an exception.

      • setExitOption

        public Menu setExitOption(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.String label)

        Sets the exit option with given key and label.

      • showMenu

        public void showMenu()

        Shows the menu built out of the given menu items and (if present) exit option.
